etymology.description: 会意: 留 (‘to stay’) + 土 (‘ground’).
etymology.interpretation: Combines 留 ‘to stay’ with 土 ‘ground’ to convey remaining on the ground, i.e., being seated. From this sense comes the extended usage ‘to take’ a vehicle, as one sits in it to ride.

examples.chinese: 我们坐在地上休息(我們坐在地上休息)。
examples.english: We sit on the ground to rest.

examples.chinese: 请坐这辆公交车去市中心(請坐這輛公交車去市中心)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng zuò zhè liàng gōngjiāochē qù shì zhōngxīn.
examples.english: Please take this bus to the city center.

examples.chinese: 我每天坐地铁上班(我每天坐地鐵上班)。
examples.english: I take the subway to work every day.
